Departments Tax Payers Court System Contact Us Search X Search Tips Search for an exact match : Put a word or phrase inside quotes. For example, "tallest building" Search for wildcards : Put a * in your word or phrase where you want to leave a placeholder. For example, "largest * in the world" Exclude words from your search : Put - in front of a word you want to leave out. For example, jaguar speed -car * Taken from and more at https://support.google.com/websearch/answer/2466433 I NEED TO... Click through to find: A helpful arrangement of frequently used Cherokee County online resources Commonly requested forms and documents for a variety of departments and agencies Links to other sites and services often used by our residents DEPARTMENTS Click through to find: Links to every department and agency under the jurisdiction of the Cherokee County Board of Commissioners Contact information for departments with the name of the department/agency head Links to common agencies not under the jurisdiction of the BOC, but which maintains close ties with us TAX PAYERS Click through to find: Information about and links to both the Tax Commissioner and Tax Assessor's Office. (They are very different organizations) Quick links to both the Paying your Taxes online and the Real Estate Search applications. Information about Homestead Exemptions Information about Property Taxes , Millage Rates , and Car Tags COURT SYSTEM Click through to find: A page listing every judicial and court system in Cherokee County with a brief introduction to what they cover Quick links to Jury Duty Information , Traffic Citation Payments , Court Calendars , Deeds and Records Search , Passport Information , and a lot more CONTACTING US Click through to find: Ways to contact the Cherokee County Board of Commissioners , Department and Agency Heads , and State Agencies and Offices Directions to all County Facilities Quick Link to Finding Your Commissioner × Home I Need To... Area Agencies A directory of government agencies, regional organizations and more. Email for General Questions or Feedback: troubleshooter@orlando.gov The City of Orlando strives to make our online services accessible for everyone. If you require a reasonable accommodation, please email your request to ADARequest@orlando.gov . **NOTICE: E-mail addresses are Public Record Under Florida law, e-mail addresses are public records. If you do not want your e-mail address released in response to a public-records request, do not send electronic mail to this entity. Instead, contact the city office by phone or in writing. Please be further advised that any writing received by the city is also a public record under Florida law and is subject to being released pursuant to a public records request. If you would like to contact the city for more information regarding this notice, please contact the City Clerk’s office at 407.246.2251. RATES & RESERVATIONS We offer two different all-inclusive seasons. Our High Season offers all of our wonderful activities and our kids program. Late Season offers all of our activities and is for ages 13 and up only as we no longer offer our kids program during this time. Rates are all-inclusive of all horseback riding, fishing, and all daily/nightly activities. We request a deposit of $500 per person to confirm your reservation. This is refundable only if canceled by March 5th and is NOT transferable to another year. Your total balance is due on May 1st. Due to our non-refundable balance policy, we strongly recommend trip insurance (Travel Guard 800-826-1300). We prefer personal checks, but do accept VISA/MC (5% service fee). Upon receiving your deposit, we will send you a Reservation Contract and a suggested packing list. One of the original parks designed by Frederick Law Olmsted, the park provides a pastoral setting amid rolling hills, open meadows and woodlands of the Beargrass Creek valley. For vehicles on the Scenic Loop (or recreational users moving in the direction of vehicle traffic), the secret to navigating the park is to keep turning left to stay in the park, or keep turning right to leave the park. The Board has 9 members one of which is Ex-Officio appointed from the legislative delegation. Board members serve 4 year terms. Members are nominated by the County Council Members and voted on by the full membership of the County Council. The current Cherokee County Development Board members are: James (Jim) M. Cudd Chairman James (Jim) M. Cudd Chairman Jim Cudd is owner James M. Cudd CPA LLC, located on Old Georgia Highway in Gaffney has been in business for over 40 years. He has a Bachelor’s of Science degree from the University of South Carolina. Vice Chairman Cudd has been a valued member of the Cherokee County Development Board since 1989 and was appointed Vice Chairman in ??. He is very active in his church and enjoy teaching Bible study. He is the father of three daughters and has six grandchildren. In addition to the Cherokee County Development Board, Jim Cudd is a member of The American Institute of CPAs, SCAPA, serves on the Tax Committee, and numerous civic and education boards. Jim Cook Vice Chair Jim Cook Vice Chair W.B. Cook Board Member W.B. Cook Board Member Doug Hubbard Board Member Doug Hubbard Board Member Hermenia Gardner Board Member Hermenia Gardner Board Member Hermenia Gardner has a lengthy background in education and various social programs. She is a retired Educator and Administrator and is active in many programs that ensure a good education for all Cherokee Residents. She has Degrees from West Chester University, Boston University, and Columbia University in New York City. Mrs. Gardner has been a valued member of the Cherokee County Development Board since 2014. In addition to the Cherokee County Development Board, she also serves as Chair of board for the Know2 Cherokee County Living Tobacco Free Coalition, Board Member Cherokee County YMCA, and serves on the Know2 Health Committee. She has held past positions as President, Spartanburg Chapter of the Links; Past President, Altrusa International of Gaffney. James R. Thompson Board Member James R. Thompson Board Member James Thompson is a partner with Saint-Amand, Thompson & Mathis, Attorneys at Law, LLC a very prestigious law firm located in Gaffney. James has been a Practicing Attorney for 50 years and is a member of both the Cherokee County Bar Association and the South Carolina Bar Association. He has a Business Administration Degree from Presbyterian College and University of S.C. Law School. James has been a valued member of the Cherokee County Development Board since 1998. Bill Sarratt Board Member Bill Sarratt Board Member Bill Sarratt is Founder and President, Sarratt Farms, which is located in Gaffney and has been in operation since 2002. He has a Degree from Furman University. He has been a valued member of the Cherokee County Development Board since 2014. In addition to the Cherokee County Development Board, he also holds the positions of Vice-Chairman, Spartanburg Community College Commission, while holding past positions as President, Spartanburg Lions Club; Past President, Carolina Country Club; Past President, Spartanburg County Cattlemen’s Association. He also has also been honored to be named Cherokee County Economic Development Ambassador 2009; SC Cattleman of the year, 2012. The Honorable Harvey S. Peeler, Jr. South Carolina Senate The Honorable Harvey S. Peeler, Jr. South Carolina Senate Harvey Smith Peeler, Jr. was elected to the South Carolina Senate and began his service to the people of Senate District 14 in November 1980. District 14 is comprised of his home county of Cherokee, along with portions of Spartanburg, Union and York Counties. Now, after 38 years of service in the South Carolina Senate, Peeler sits as the third most senior senator. Following the 2005 legislative session, Senator Peeler accepted the position of Majority Leader of the Senate of South Carolina. This historic honor was bestowed upon him by his fellow Republican Senators and in doing so Peeler became only the second South Carolina Republican to be named Senate Majority Leader since the end of the Reconstruction Era. He served as Majority Leader until he resigned that position in March 2015. In January 2005, Peeler was appointed chairman of the Senate Medical Affairs Committee, a position he still holds today. During his time as chairman, the Senate has been able to pass significant legislation of the reform of medical practice in South Carolina. Prior to his appointment as Medical Affairs Committee Chairman, Peeler was head of the Senate Fish, Game and Forestry Committee for five years. Aside from his committee chairmanship, Senator Peeler is heavily involved in the inner workings of the Senate. In 2007, he was appointed as vice-chairman of the Senate Finance Committee. In addition to Medical Affairs and Finance, Peeler is currently a member of the Senate Education, Ethics, Interstate Cooperation, and Transportation committees. He also chairs both the State House Committee and the College and University Board of Trustees Screening Committee, and serves on the Joint Bond Review Committee, and the Senate Operations and Management Committee. As a member of the State House Committee, Peeler and other legislators were charged with overseeing the most extensive renovation of the State House since its construction. The project was completed and the State House reopened to visitors in August 1998. The South Carolina General Assembly held its first session in the refurbished State House in 1999. Over the years, numerous groups have recognized Senator Peeler for his dedicated service to the state of South Carolina and its people. The South Carolina Business and Industry Political Education Committee (BIPEC) acknowledged him for his exceptional support of the business community in both 1996 and 1998. Also in 1996, the South Carolina School Boards Association named him one of three Outstanding Legislators, and Lake Wylie, South Carolina named him as the “Citizen of the Year”. Senator Peeler was honored as “Legislator of the Year” by the South Carolina Poultry Federation in 1996, and by the South Carolina Rural Water Association in 1999. The South Carolina Association of Taxpayers honored him with the “Friend of the Taxpayer Award” in 2003 and 2013. The South Carolina Department of Education in 2005 recognized Peeler for his outstanding contributions to public education. In 2011, the American Legion Department of South Carolina presented him with their Special Legislative Award in appreciation for his many years of outstanding service to his community, state and nation. Thanks to his leadership and pro-business approach in the Senate, the South Carolina Chamber of Commerce named Peeler its “2007 Public Servant of the Year”. His dedication to the State has also been recognized by both the Medical University of South Carolina and Clemson University, which bestowed upon him honorary doctoral degrees in 2008 and 2009, respectively. For his leadership in insuring South Carolina’s foster children have easy access to education, Peeler received the 2010 “Legislator of the Year” award from the South Carolina Association of Children’s Homes and Family Services. That same year, 2010, Spartanburg Community College named their academic building on the Cherokee County Campus the Harvey S. Peeler, Jr. Academic Building. Senator Peeler and his wife, the former Donna Caudill, are the proud parents of three children: Brantlee Peeler Morgan, H. Smith Peeler, III, and Boone, and seven grandchildren. He is the son of the late H. Smith Peeler and Sally Bratton Peeler of Gaffney. A lifelong dairyman and businessman in Cherokee County, Peeler and his family are active members of Gaffney First Baptist Church. He is both a Mason and a Shriner. Prior to his election to the South Carolina Senate, he was a member of the Cherokee County Council from 1977-1980. Peeler also served as a lieutenant in the United States Army. In 1970, he graduated with a Bachelor of Science degree from Clemson University. Andrea McCraw Board Member Andrea McCraw Board Member The Cherokee County Development Board offices are located in the Spartanburg Community College Cherokee Business Training Center building just off I-85 near Gaffney. The Development Board meets every 4th Monday of the month at 12 p.m. Meetings are open to the public and advertised through local media outlets.
